If you want to draw meaningful conclusions from a data set,  
you should visualize it as it might otherwise mislead you.  
  
For many scenarios in empirical sciences, so called raincloud plots are incredibly useful for this. 
  
In [this blog post](https://jasp-stats.org/2024/07/26/raincloud-plots-in-jasp-incredibly-useful-surprisingly-easy/) I explain how raincloud plots work and  
how you can easily use them to visualize your own data.
